WILL HISTORY REPEAT ITSELF?

Historically, Bitcoin reaches its cycle peak around 18 months after each halving.

If this pattern holds, the next peak could occur in September, aligning with a potential Fed rate cut.

But what makes this cycle different?

‚û°Ô∏è  It's institutionally driven
‚û°Ô∏è  Exhibits less volatility

Unlike past cycles, we may be in a longer, more sustained bull run.

A Fed rate cut could further fuel this momentum, potentially signaling the beginning of an extended bull market.

Bonus

Did we kill off everyone playing in DeFi from 2020 to 2022?

Back then, we had similar arguments about stablecoins; interest rates drove their adoption. That was the appeal of OlympusDAO and UST; huge interest rates.

Take away interest rates and what's left?

7/7

There is one way to reach Bessent's "very reasonable number" of $2T in stablecoins within a decade.

10x the price of crypto ($1m of stablecoins to buy 1 $BTC, vs $100k now).

If this is what they think, then say it this way.

6/7

Remittances and Merchant Payments are basic tradFi functions. MMMFs and demand deposit accounts pay interest.

Why would anyone trade out of them into a non-interest-bearing instrument?

(Answer: they would not if acting rationally.)

5/7

For holders of stablecoins, it is "dead money" (no interest). This means the issuer keeps all the interest from the Treasuries that collateralize them.

Is this why $CRCL is up 500% since its June 4th IPO?
By keeping all the interest, it has the fattest margins in Tradfi?

4/7

There is a big problem, as @DavidSacks explains: the banking industry is afraid of them.

The GENUIS Act legislates that stablecoins will not pay interest to the holders.

3/7

However, the hope is that the other 6%, such as remittances and merchant payments, will soar with the regulatory clarity provided by the GENIUS Act.

2/7

First, what are stablecoins used for? 88% are for trading, DeFi, or Treasury functions. In other words, on-chain functions (which need a dollar proxy).

Regulatory clarity is not needed for these purposes.

1/7

I don't think it's about "fesh" USD for stablecoins.

It's about regulatory clarity creating demand for stablecoins, which in turn drives new demand for ST Treasuries.

But I'm skeptical this will even happen. The GENIUS ACT potentially has a fatal flaw.

However:

Slowing immigration, increased deportations, and the continuing low fertility rate (for decades), means population growth has really slowed.

This has lead some estimates that the economy now only needs to create 20k to 40k jobs a month to meet the now lower population growth.

So yes, 74k private sector jobs is slowing. But it‚Äôs more than enough to meet the economy‚Äôs needs. 

The bond market reacted appropriately given this reality.

Earlier this week there was discussion on FinTwit about how great of a Fed Chair Jerome Powell has been. 

I would like to respectfully and wholeheartedly disagree. 

The Powell Fed has proven that it no longer serves the public.

It has stopped fighting inflation, deepened inequality, and quietly handed monetary control back to the U.S. Treasury ‚Äî all without saying a word.

That‚Äôs what Powell‚Äôs Fed has done.

The latest data shows inflation in Europe's largest economy continues to ease.

Germany's annual consumer price inflation softened to 2.0% in June, down 2.1% in May, and below forecasts of 2.2%.

This represents the lowest level recorded since October 2024.

Since 2019, US home prices have shot up nearly 30% when adjusted for inflation, according to a report from the State of the Nation's Housing.

The increase, however, has varied widely depending on the city.

Losing weight and being healthy is a 40% cost reduction opportunity for all of us.  Why are we paying for repeated self-inflicted problems?

Anyone who complains about healthcare being ‚Äúfree‚Äù for people who don‚Äôt work needs to look themselves in the mirror first.

Healthcare costs are expensive because everyone in this country is overweight and obese. 

Get yourself healthy and lose weight. That‚Äôs how costs drop.

The past is dead.
It exists only in your mind, and you are the one keeping it alive. But here‚Äôs the truth: the past has no inherent meaning except for the meaning you choose to assign to it. You don‚Äôt have to forget what happened or pretend it didn‚Äôt exist. You simply have to revise its meaning.

That is the secret to happiness.
That is the gateway to success.

Would you like to know the first and most important secret to becoming hugely successful?

Ok, here it is:
Stop being bitter about the past.

Beacause all the money or success in the world isn't going to do anything to make your sorry ass happy, if you can't be so intensely grateful for being alive, that the past doesn't matter. 

When you become and live THAT, amazing things become possible in every aspect of your life.
